thread.title: Thanksgiving Four Ways at Arizona Biltmore, From Gourmet Dinner to Lavish BuffetTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Thanksgiving Four Ways at Arizona Biltmore, From Gourmet Dinner to Lavish BuffetTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Thanksgiving Four Ways at Arizona Biltmore, From Gourmet Dinner to Lavish Buffet Published on : Friday, October 9, 2015
Celebrate Thanksgiving in the historic setting of the Arizona Biltmore – with either epicurean dining in signature Wright’s at The Biltmore, a holiday feast in Frank & Albert’s, an extravagant buffet with all your favorite Thanksgiving dishes in the Gold Room, or gourmet take-out prepared by the resort’s talented culinary team so you can enjoy a family holiday dinner at home without all the work. Plus a variety of activities and events will be offered to kick off the holiday season, along with a special room rate for a Thanksgiving getaway.
Thanksgiving Buffet in the Gold Room: A bountiful cornucopia of holiday and favorite dishes will be served in the gracious setting of the Gold Room. The lavish buffet features Roast Organic Turkey with Sage Walnut Stuffing & Giblet Gravy, Prime Rib of Angus Beef with Natural Jus, Glazed Ham with Apple Cider Jus, and an array of stations including Starters, Small Plates, Hot, Carving, Candy Land and Kids Station.
Served: 11:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.
Cost: Adults $85, children 12 and under $40, 5 and under free. Includes tax and gratuity.
Four-Course Thanksgiving Menu in Wright’s at The Biltmore: A four-course gourmet dining experience will be served in the resort’s signature restaurant.
– First Course: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup or Lobster Celeriac Bisque.
– Second Course: Foie Torchon, Roasted Beets & House Cured Salmon, Pan Seared Diver Scallops or Farmers Fall Salad.
– Third Course: Loch Duart Salmon, Herb Crusted Lamb Loin, Roasted Turkey Breast & Confit
or Filet of Beef Au Poivre.
– Fourth Course: Brandy Pumpkin Cheesecake, Sticky Toffee Pudding or Chocolate Flourless Torte.
Served: 1:00 p.m. to 9:00 p.m.
Cost: Adults $95, children 12 and under $45. Tax and gratuity additional.
Thanksgiving Extravaganza in Frank & Albert’s: A Thanksgiving feast in popular Frank & Albert’s will feature a selection of soup, salad and pasta starters to choose from, four carving table choices, a variety of sides, and an extravagant dessert buffet.
– First Course: Smoked Turkey Gumbo, Roasted Pumpkin Soup, Waldorf Salad, Crab Cake, Tortellini.
– Carving Table: Roast Organic Turkey, Angus Prime Rib of Beef, Honey Glazed Ham, Salmon En Croûte
– Sides: Baked Mac N Cheese, Buttermilk Mashed Potatoes with White Cheddar, Sweet Potato Gratin, Harvest Vegetable Medley, Stuffing
– Dessert Extravaganza: Assorted Pies, Tortes, Hot Desserts.
Served: 2:00 p.m. to 10:00 p.m.
Cost: $58 per person. Tax and gratuity additional.
A limited dining a la carte menu will also be available on Thanksgiving.
Thanksgiving Take-Out Menu:
A complete Thanksgiving dinner prepared by the resort’s chefs for 10 people is $245 with turkey or ham as the main course, or $295 with prime rib. Included are gravy, homemade stuffing, green string beans, mashed potatoes, mashed sweet potatoes, fresh cranberry sauce, pumpkin pie and key lime pie. A wide selection of items may also be ordered a la carte including turkeys, hams and prime rib, side dishes, soups, salads, desserts, and cheese, vegetable crudité and fruit platters.
– Orders must be placed by Monday, November 23.
– Orders may be picked up between 3:00 p.m. and 5:00 p.m. on Wednesday, November 25, or between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. on November 26.
Source:-Arizona Biltmore
